thread.title: Hillary Clinton to speak to S.C.’s largest gay civil rights group next month
thread.title_full: Hillary Clinton to speak to S.C.’s largest gay civil rights group next month - Post and Courier

author: Schuyler Kropf
title: Hillary Clinton to speak to S.C.’s largest gay civil rights group next month
text:
Hillary Rodham Clinton Democratic presidential front-runner Hillary Clinton will address South Carolina’s largest lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender civil rights organization next month in Columbia, organizers said Friday.
Online
 South Carolina politics, go to palmettopolitics.com or download for iOS or Android .
Clinton will take part in “An Evening with Hillary” on Nov. 7, the group S.C. Equality announced.
The appearance will be in front of 300 grassroots leaders from across the state, including SC Equality’s board of directors and staff, volunteer leaders and supporters.
“While serving in the U.S. Senate, Sen. Clinton had a vigorous and sustained record of support for the LGBT community,” said Jeff Ayers, board chairman of S.C. Equality.
“As Secretary of State, she initiated the Global Equality Fund to encourage fair treatment for LGBT people internationally and extended equal benefits and protections for same-sex partners of American diplomats.”
Ayres said Clinton’s presidential run “continues to bring LGBT equality to the forefront of America.”
The event will be at the Columbia Marriott beginning at 6 p.m.
Tickets are available at scequalityevents.org .
Clinton’s appearance comes a day after the Democratic presidential candidates will appear for a joint forum at Winthrop University in Rock Hill.
Reach Schuyler Kropf at 937-5551.
